name: Cepsa Chemicals Cumene
description: Cepsa Chemicals Cumene is produced through the catalytic alkylation of benzene with propylene. Both raw materials are derived from crude oil distillation. The bulk of cumene production is typically transformed into cumene hydroperoxide, an intermediate in the synthesis of essential chemicals like phenol and acetone. Additionally, cumene is used in surfactants, the production of propylene Oxide (PO), and as an additive in gasoline.

Synonyms: (1-Methylethyl)-Benzene, (Methylethyl)benzene, (Propan-2-yl)benzene, 1-Methylethyl-Benzene, 2-Fenyl-propaan, 2-Phenyl propane, Benzene,Isopropyl Cumol, Cumol, i-Propyl-Benzene, Isopropyl Benzene, Isopropylbenzol
